text: The EPA Army is coming! The 'Climate Change Liberation Army' Read our Forbes editorial click here Forbes | October 21, 2015 Why does the EPA need a a $715 million police force, $170 million PR Machine, a nearly $1 billion employment agency for seniors, and a $1.2 billion in-house law firm? In the Democratic Presidential debate last week, Sen. Bernie Sanders stated that the greatest threat to the United States was "climate change." The EPA is ready for the fight in ways most taxpayers couldn't have imagined. Recently, our organization published the OpenTheBooks Oversight Report - U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. We captured and analyzed $108 billion worth of EPA contracts (FY2000-2014), grants (FY2000-2014), salaries (FY2007-2014) and bonuses (FY2000-2014). Here's a summary: read our Forbes editorial, The EPA Climate Change Liberation Army, click here Since 2006, the EPA Criminal Enforcement Program spent approximately $715 million fighting 'enviro-crime.'
